## WARNING: Please understand nature of Akane Tori in this section before reading further:    
This script relies on BIAS indicator and RSI indicator for investment rebalancing.   
Please understand BIAS indicator and RSI indicator before reading further.    
The script perform walk-forward validation only.   
A model will be created for exactly next re-balance only based on most updated data for that moment.     
There is no other validation or assessment on the data.      
Please be reminded that backtesting and/or walk-forward validation is no way to be accurate in predicting future performance.      
Using this script may exposed to various risk, including but not limited to overfitting, market, timing, etc.     

## 警告：在應用Akane Tori之前，請先於此節了解Akane Tori的特性   
Akane Tori根據乖離值及相對強弱指數作投資組合再配置。      
閱讀下文前，請先了解乖離值及相對強弱指數。    
Akane模組會在市場大幅波動的高風險環境下作出投資，可能會承受巨大損失。    
此模式只使用了前移式回測(walk-forward validation)。    
每次資產調配都會基於擁有當時而言的最新資料。    
然而，請切記過往表現不代表將來表現。    
使用此代碼將會受到包括但不限於以下的風險所影響：過擬合風險、市場風險、時差風險等。   


## Background Introduction
Mandatory Provident Fund (MPF) is one of the legal pensions in Hongkong.  
All Employers and some employees are required to pay at least 5% of monthly salary to MPF services provider.  
MPF providers are required to provide approved funds for employees to invest, 
while the team could earn management fees.  

However, the average annualized return of MPF is 3.1% only in from 2000-2016 (Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority, 2016).  
Most Hongkong employees feels they are forced to give their salary to MPF fund manager.  
Indeed, the reasons of low return may due to inactive management by employees.  
In this example, we will explore n-m MA BIAS to rise the annualized return in Akane Tori.  

## 背景簡介     
在香港，強積性公積金(強積金, Mandatory Provident Fund, MPF)是其中一種法定退休金。    
僱主及部份僱員須扣除5%薪金供強積金營運商。   
強積金營運商將每月收取管理費，並提供認可基金供僱員作投資儲蓄。   
但是，強積金的平均回報僅3.1%，因而被批評回報有三份之一被基金經理蠶食。   
誠言，每位僱員如以主動方式管理強積金，有助提升回報而減少收費的影響。   
這文記錄了作者以時差平均線乖離率(n-m MA BIAS)提升強積金回報的探索(即Akane Tori)。   


## Akane Tori used NMMA BIAS & Relative Strength Index (RSI)
The author used n-m MA BIAS indicator (NMMA BIAS) to extract trend and RSI for overbuy/oversell status in Akane Tori.    
This script combine two indicators and consider recent stock returns for the three outcome:   
1. Tactical Asset Allocation (TAA) using Akane Tori
2. Strategic Asset Allocation (SAA) using Akane Tori and designated funds
3. Hedging mode (cash mode)   

## Akane Tori 應用了時差平均線乖離率及相對強弱指數   
作者嘗試以時差平均線乖離率(n-m MA BIAS, NMMA BIAS)及相對強(RSI)分配投資物。    
時差平均線乖離率的預測考慮了投資物的趨勢(Trend)。  　 
相對強弱指數則考慮投資物的超買超賣狀態。    
本程序結合兩項指標後，再考慮考慮最近三至六個月回報後，程式將自動決定以Akane Tori佈置戰術性資產部署(tactical asset allocation, TAA) 、或是以Akane Tori結果配合債券及現金的策略性資產部署(Strategic asset allocation)、或進入避險模式。    


### When to manage my portfolio using Akane Tori?   
The author collect historical pricing in the last day of every month to calculate NMMA BIAS and RSI in Akane Tori.   
The same day would be the day of successful rebalance.    
In this example, MPF would have T+2 time delay for obtaining historical price, hence it is expected to have timing risks in Akane Tori in MPF.    

### 何時使用Akane Tori管理及調配投資組合?   
作者以每月最後一日取得投資物的歷史價格計算每月回報、NMMA BIAS及相對強弱指數。   
然後於同日重新配置投資物。    
在本示例中，強積金大部分均有T+2的時延，因此實際操作將有時延誤差。

2. Calculate Simple Moving Average (SMA) 
```{r warning=FALSE}
MPF.HSBC.SMA.hy <- na.fill(apply(MPF.HSBC, 2, function(x) SMA(x, n=21*MA_long)), 0)
MPF.HSBC.SMA.hy <- as.xts(MPF.HSBC.SMA.hy, order.by = daily)
MPF.HSBC.SMA.mt <- na.fill(apply(MPF.HSBC, 2, function(x) SMA(x, n=21*MA_Short)), 0)
MPF.HSBC.SMA.mt <- as.xts(MPF.HSBC.SMA.mt, order.by = daily)
```

3. Calculate Relative Strength Index (RSI)
```{r warning=FALSE} 
MPF.HSBC.RSI <- na.fill(apply(MPF.HSBC, 2, function(x) RSI(x, n=21*RSI_Period)),0)
MPF.HSBC.RSI <- as.xts(MPF.HSBC.RSI, order.by = daily)
```

### Calculate average RSI of the month, and then adjustment factor
```{r warning=FALSE}
MPF.HSBC.RSI.month <-
  as.xts(do.call(rbind, lapply(split(as.xts(MPF.HSBC.RSI),
                                     "months"), function(x)
                                       colAvgs(x))), order.by = monthly)

MPF.HSBC.RSI.p <- MPF.HSBC.returns
MPF.HSBC.RSI.p[, ] <- 0

for (col in 1:length(MPF.HSBC.RSI.month[1, ])) {
  if (col != 10) {
    for (row in 1:length(MPF.HSBC.RSI.month[, col])) {
      percentile <- ecdf(as.numeric(MPF.HSBC.RSI.month[1:row, col]))
      if (percentile(MPF.HSBC.RSI.month[row, col]) >=
          (RSI_Overbuy - 1 / length(1:row) ^ (1 / 2))) {
        MPF.HSBC.RSI.p[row, col] <- 0.2
      } else {
        MPF.HSBC.RSI.p[row, col] <-
          1.2 - (percentile(MPF.HSBC.RSI.month[row, col]) ^ (3))
      }
    }
  } else {
    MPF.HSBC.RSI.p[, col] <- 1
  }
}

MPF.HSBC.RSI.sum <-
  as.xts(rowSums(MPF.HSBC.RSI.p), order.by = monthly)
```

```{r warning=FALSE}
MPF.onefive <- exp(log(MPF.break.even) - 0.4)
MPF.twofive <- exp(log(MPF.break.even) - 0.2)


for (row in 1:length(MPF.HSBC.returns[, 1])) {
  if (row <= 6) {
    AKANE.portf.weight[row, 10] <- 1
    list.to.buy <- c()
    num.to.buy <- 1
  } else {
    temp.list <- c()
    temp.value <- c()
    temp.num <- 1
    for (col in 1:length(MPF.HSBC.returns[1, ])) {
      if (row != 7) {
        if (!is.na(MPF.break.even[row, col]) &&
            !is.nan(MPF.break.even[row, col]) &&
            col %in% list.to.buy &&
            as.double(MPF.month.price[row, col]) <
            as.double(MPF.onefive[MPF.HSBC.last.sell[col], col])) {
          temp.list[temp.num] <- col
          temp.value[col] <- (as.double(MPF.month.price[row, col]) -
                                as.double(MPF.onefive[MPF.HSBC.last.sell[col], col]))*3
          temp.num <- temp.num + 1
        } else if (!is.na(MPF.break.even[row, col]) &&
                   !is.nan(MPF.break.even[row, col]) &&
                   col %in% list.to.buy &&
                   as.double(MPF.month.price[row, col]) >
                   as.double(MPF.onefive[MPF.HSBC.last.sell[col], col]) &&
                   (as.double(MPF.month.price[row, col]) <
                    as.double(MPF.twofive[MPF.HSBC.last.sell[col], col]))) {
          temp.list[temp.num] <- col
          temp.value[col] <- (as.double(MPF.month.price[row, col]) -
                                as.double(MPF.twofive[MPF.HSBC.last.sell[col], col]))
          temp.num <- temp.num + 1
        } else if (!is.na(MPF.break.even[row, col]) &&
                   !is.nan(MPF.break.even[row, col]) &&
                   col %in% list.to.buy &&
                   (as.double(MPF.month.price[row, col]) >=
                    as.double(MPF.twofive[MPF.HSBC.last.sell[col], col]))) {
          MPF.HSBC.last.sell[col] <- row

        }
      }
    }
    
    list.to.buy <- c(temp.list)
    list.of.value <- c(temp.value)
    num.to.buy <- temp.num
    for (col in 1:length(MPF.HSBC.returns[1, ])) {
      if (!is.na(MPF.break.even[row - 5, col]) &&
          !col %in% list.to.buy &&
          as.double(MPF.month.price[row, col]) < 
          as.double(MPF.onefive[MPF.HSBC.last.sell[col], col])) {
        list.to.buy[num.to.buy] <- col
        list.of.value[col] <- as.double(MPF.month.price[row, col]) -
          as.double(MPF.onefive[MPF.HSBC.last.sell[col], col])
        num.to.buy <- num.to.buy + 1
      }
    }
    #print(list.of.value)
    
    if (num.to.buy != 1) {
      for (col in list.to.buy) {
        AKANE.portf.weight[row, col] <- 1 / (num.to.buy - 1)
      }
    } else {
      if (row >= 198) {
        AKANE.portf.weight[row, 6] <- 0.3
        AKANE.portf.weight[row, 10] <- 0.3
        AKANE.portf.weight[row, 19] <- 0.4
      } else if (row >= 110) {
        AKANE.portf.weight[row, 6] <- 0.5
        AKANE.portf.weight[row, 10] <- 0.5
      } else {
        AKANE.portf.weight[row, 10] <- 1
      }
    }
  }
  
}
```

```{r warning=FALSE}
up <- TRUE
hedge <- FALSE

round_percent <- function(x) {
  x <- x * 100
  result <- floor(x)    # Find integer bits
  remain <- x - result
  rsum <- sum(result)   # Find out how much we are missing
  i <- 1
  if (rsum < 100) {
    o <- order(remain, decreasing = TRUE)
    while (rsum < 100) {
      if (i > length(remain)) i <- 1
      idx <- o[i]
      if (result[idx] == 0) {
        i <- i+1
        next
      }
      result[idx] <- result[idx] + 1
      rsum <- sum(result)
      i <- i+1
    }
  }
  result <- result/100
  return(result)
}


MPF.HSBC.returns.mat <- as.matrix(MPF.HSBC.returns)
MPF.HSBC.stock.mean <- 0
for (row in 1:length(MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[, 1])) {
  MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row,] <-
    (MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row,]) * MPF.HSBC.RSI.p[row,]
  
  MPF.HSBC.stock.mean <- 0
  i <- 0
  for (col in 1:length(MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[1,])) {
    if (col != 2 && col != 3 && col != 6 && col != 10 &&
        col != 12 && col != 15) {
      if (col != 3 && (col < 14 || col > 19) &&
          !is.na(MPF.HSBC.returns.mat[row, col]) &&
          MPF.HSBC.returns.mat[row, col] != 0) {
        MPF.HSBC.stock.mean <-
          MPF.HSBC.stock.mean + MPF.HSBC.returns.mat[row, col]
        i <- i + 1
      }
      
      if (col == 3 || MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, col] < 1e-6 ||
          (monthly[row] < "2019-07-01" && col >= 14 && col <= 18)) {
        MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, col] <- 0
      }
    } else {
      if (MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, col] < 0) {
        MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, col] <- 0
      }
    }
  }
  
  MPF.HSBC.stock.return[row] <- MPF.HSBC.stock.mean / i
  
  if (is.nan(MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, col])) {
    MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, col] <- 0
  }
  
  # Retain two most increasing fund
  last <- length(MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[1, ]) - top
  
  order <- order(MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, ])[1:last]
  for (col in order) {
    MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, col] <- 0
  }
  
  MPF.HSBC.sum <- sum(MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, ])
  MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, ]
  MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[] <- 0
  
  
  if (row > 8 && MPF.HSBC.stock.return[row] <
      quantile(na.omit(MPF.HSBC.stock.return), c(.35)) &&
      MPF.HSBC.stock.return[row - 3] <
      quantile(na.omit(MPF.HSBC.stock.return), c(.45))) {
    up <- FALSE
  }
  
  if (row > 8 && hedge &&
      MPF.HSBC.stock.return[row] >
      quantile(na.omit(MPF.HSBC.stock.return), c(.45))  &&
      MPF.HSBC.stock.return[row - 3] >
      quantile(na.omit(MPF.HSBC.stock.return), c(.35))) {
    hedge <- FALSE
    up <- TRUE
  }
  
  if (row > 8 &&  (MPF.HSBC.stock.return[row] < 0 &&
                   MPF.HSBC.stock.return[row - 1] >
                   quantile(na.omit(MPF.HSBC.stock.return), c(.8)))) {
    hedge <- TRUE
  }
  
  MPF.HSBC.sum <- sum(MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row,])
  MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[] <- 0
  
  
  if (row <= 12) {
    MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] <- 1
  } else if (MPF.HSBC.sum == MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, 10] ||
             MPF.HSBC.sum < 1e-6 || hedge == TRUE) {
    MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p <- as.vector(AKANE.portf.weight[row, ]) * 0.75
    if (row >= 198) {
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[6] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[6] + 0.09
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] + 0.1
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[19] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[19] + 0.06
    } else if (row >= 110) {
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[6] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[6] + 0.1
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] + 0.15
    } else {
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] <-  MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] + 0.25
    }
  } else if (min(MPF.HSBC.stock.return[(row - 3):row]) < -0.075) {
    if (row >= 198) {
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[] <-
        MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, ] / MPF.HSBC.sum / 10 * 7
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[19] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[19] + 0.12
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] + 0.08
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[6] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[6] + 0.1
    } else if (row >= 110) {
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[] <-
        MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, ] / MPF.HSBC.sum / 10 * 7
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] + 0.12
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[6] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[6] + 0.18
    } else {
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[] <-
        MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, ] / MPF.HSBC.sum / 10 * 7
      MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[10] + 0.3
    }
  } else {
    MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.month[row, ] / MPF.HSBC.sum
  }
  
  # Change NA to VCNA after 2019-07-01
  
  if (MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[1] != 0 && monthly[row] > "2019-07-01") {
    MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[14] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[14] + MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[1]
    MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[1] <- 0
  }
  
  if (MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[5] != 0 && monthly[row] > "2019-07-01") {
    MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[16] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[16] + MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[5]
    MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[5] <- 0
  }
  
  if (MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[11] != 0 && monthly[row] > "2019-07-01") {
    MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[17] <- MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[17] + MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[11]
    MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p[11] <- 0
  }
  
  MPF.portf.weight[row, ] <-
    round_percent(MPF.HSBC.BIAS.p)
  
  if (row == 1) {
    portf.rebal.fm <- na.fill(MPF.HSBC.simple.returns[row, ], 0) *
      MPF.portf.weight[row, ]
  } else {
    portf.rebal.fm <-
      Return.portfolio(
        na.fill(MPF.HSBC.simple.returns[1:row, ], 0),
        weight = MPF.portf.weight,
        geometric = TRUE,
        rebalance_on = "months"
      )
  }
  
  MPF.portf.return[row] <-
    tail(na.omit(portf.rebal.fm), 1)
  MPF.portf.drawdown <- Drawdowns(MPF.portf.return,
                                  geometric = TRUE)
  
  if (tail(na.omit(MPF.portf.drawdown), 1) < -0.065 &&
      up == FALSE) {
    hedge = TRUE
  }
}
```

### Monthly Installment
```{r linewidth=159, warning=FALSE}
MPF.HSBC.units <- MPF.HSBC.returns
MPF.HSBC.units[,] <- 0

MPF.monthly.asset <- MPF.HSBC.returns
MPF.monthly.asset[,] <- 0

MPF.monthly.returns <-
  as.xts(rowSums(MPF.HSBC.returns), order.by = monthly)
MPF.monthly.returns[] <- 0

MPF.time <- 0:length(MPF.HSBC.returns[, 1]) / 12
MPF.pay <- -2301 + 0 * MPF.time


for (row in 1:length(MPF.HSBC.returns[, 1])) {
  #for (row in 1:13) {
  this.price <- as.matrix(MPF.HSBC[monthly[row]])
  MPF.HSBC.units[row,] <- this.price
  
  if (row == 1) {
    
    last.value <- 2301
    this.value <- as.numeric((2301 / MPF.HSBC[1, 10]) * this.price[10])
    MPF.monthly.returns[row] <- (this.value-last.value) / last.value
    MPF.monthly.asset[row,] <-
      (this.value + 2301) / this.price * MPF.portf.weight[row, ]
    last.price <- this.price
  
  } else {
    last.value <-
      as.numeric(sum(na.fill(last.price * MPF.monthly.asset[row - 1, ], 0)))
    this.value <-
      as.numeric(sum(na.fill(this.price * MPF.monthly.asset[row - 1, ], 0)))
    MPF.monthly.returns[row] <- (this.value -last.value) / last.value
    MPF.monthly.asset[row,] <-
      (this.value + 2301) / this.price * MPF.portf.weight[row, ]
    last.price <- this.price

  }
}


total.asset.value <- sum(MPF.monthly.asset[row,] * this.price)
total.contribution <- 2301 * length(MPF.HSBC.returns[, 1])

MPF.pay[row + 1] <- total.asset.value
IRR.f <- function(r)
  sum(MPF.pay * exp(-r * MPF.time))
IRR.root <- uniroot(IRR.f, c(0, 1))

cat("Total asset in the last valuation date: ", total.asset.value, "\n")
cat("Total contribution starting from 2000/12/01: ",
    total.contribution,
    "\n")

mean.monthly.annual.return <-
  mean(do.call(rbind, lapply(split(MPF.monthly.returns, "years"), function(x)
    colMeans(x))) * 12)
cat("Mean Annual Return: ", mean.monthly.annual.return, "\n")
cat("Internal Rate of Return (IRR): ", IRR.root$root, "\n")

stddev.monthly <- (StdDev(MPF.monthly.returns) * sqrt(12))
monthly.installment.sharpe.ratio <-
  mean.monthly.annual.return / stddev.monthly
rownames(monthly.installment.sharpe.ratio) <-
  "Sharpe Ratio (mean annual return)"

StdDev.annualized(MPF.monthly.returns)
monthly.installment.sharpe.ratio
SortinoRatio(MPF.monthly.returns) * sqrt(12)
ES(MPF.monthly.returns, method = "historical")
```
